Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy S
Reviews.Content: After traveling by car from Siena to the Rome airport to drop off our rental car and taking a taxi to the hotel arriving around 9:30pm, they tell us that we don't have a reservation. I had my written confirmation showing them that the room was paid for for two nights. Sorry, we are full and cannot take you. Finally, they admitted that it was their mistake (not right away, after we said we were calling the travel agent). They then found us another hotel nearby and paid for our taxi ride there. Which is what I would expect, but did not expect to be w/out a hotel room that was paid for over two months in advance. Very unhappy traveler.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: nytech
Reviews.Content: The room was smelly and dingy, but for the price it was what to be expected. The main problem is the neighborhood. It is near the main train station and low life degenerates were everywhere. I felt them sizing me up to see if they can mug me or take advantage of me. I am from a rough neighborhood in the South Bronx, NY so I don't scare easily, but I must admit I was a little nervous walking through this area.

Reviews.Title: “ambra palace”
Reviews.Author: kateSoutheast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ambra Palace for 4 nights our room was spotless and clean we had clean bedding every day and clean white fluffy towels. There was a kettle to make tea and coffe which was supplied for you. Our room was at the back and very quiet although it looked on to the back of a lot of apartments but this did not bother us as we was out all day.The breakfast room very pleasant and clean and there was a good variety of food to eat.We could not fault the hotel. The staff were all very pleasant. The only down side was out side which was scruffy and there was a lot of grafitti around but do not let this put you off as there were a lot of places in Rome like it, we blame the goverment who should do some thing about it and clean up the streets. We would certainly stay there again as it was very convenient and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: LuisF2010
Reviews.Content: Pros: a) near Termini central train station (accesible via Leonardo Express train from the airport). Also accesible via Metro and bus lines. b) friendly staff, took their time to explain how to reach attractions, point out good restaurants. c) room was comfortable, nice, well decorated. d) breakfast buffet is OK. e) free wifi, free safety box, Cons: - neighborhood is not the best. - shower stall is very narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent Comfort”
Reviews.Author: epocmot
Reviews.Content: Elegent Hotel with helpful staff.Breakfast was included and ok for a european hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Rusty A
Reviews.Content: After our less-than-stellar experience as "first class" (yeah, right, sure) passengers on the night train from Paris to Rome, this hotel came as a huge surprise. The room was gorgeous and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Yes, it's in a rundown part of town and there are lots of people living there who do not appear to be Italian. On the other hand, the front desk could get us a taxi almost immediately, and there were a number of really fine restaurants within walking distance. They don't have a dining room per-se', but they have a great free breakfast buffet, and they'll happily sell you sandwiches and other things later in the day (although it's a little slow since the bar mad does the cooking).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Bed not so comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen N
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice feel once you enter the lobby. The rooms are small by U.S. standards, but normal for European. The bed was not comfortable by any standard and the shower stall was quite small, with intermittent hot water and low water pressure. As a "homebase" for touring Rome, it worked well for our visit. If you rely on a hotel to make the trip comfortable, this probably isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL - LOUSY DINNERS”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover34996
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best on our 10 day tour. We were assigned a "superior" room by luck and it was great. A corner room with front and side windows and a full bathroom that included a jacuzzi tub and plenty of room. What a releif from the stall showers that you could hardly turn around in. The hotel does not have a full dining room, but accommodates tours with catered meals that leave a lot to be desired. I would have preferred no meal plan to the bland dinners we received. There is an excellent deli type business just down the street that has good food at reasonable proces. The breakfast were very good for Europe. The hotel is located in a central, but seedy part of town. Some of the women on our tour were afraid to go out of the hotel on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good but the surrounding area lets it down”
Reviews.Author: philipvicky
Reviews.Content: Room cosy with a large bed and well equipped, although the carpet could do with being replaced and the wallpaper above the tv area was thick with dust, never sorted out how to work the air con. Bathroom had a very small shower cubicle with doors which had to be opened in a particular way so as they would not fall off. Breakfast choice good, although I have never had peas for breakfast before. Staff were efficient, polite, welcoming and very friendly. Close to station and metro, not many Italian restaurants in the area but ok if you like Indian food. We liked to be back at the Hotel early evening as we found the area made you feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Martin B
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Tasmania to Rome on the 13th Sept 2011 the Ambra Palace was a relief. The front desk staff were welcoming and very helpful when asked about the Metro and location of buses etc. The breakfast was more than adequate and varied daily with a good selection for vegetarians. Special mention must go to Senore Diego the Breakfast Manager . A complete professional at all times, he was courteous, helpful and most obliging. So Thank You Senore Diego. The rooms are a bit on the small side and the shower was very arkward to work out. But Hey when in Rome! Yes it is in a multi- cultured neighbourhood however we felt this added colour and flavour and felt quite safe at all times.. There are many small restaurants nearby, the Milky Bar seems very popular and is less than a block away.Opposite the hotel are two large markets; one selling all manner of clothing,bags and shoes. The other is fresh produce; a bonus if you have a craving for their delicious peaches and grapes. So tip #1 Be adventurous and try them as there are bargains to be had. The location is ideal for those needing theTermini Station, a ten minute walk away and the Metro is just behind the hotel. You can walk to the Colloseum and the Forum. We had four exciting nights in Rome due partly to the Hotel Ambra Palace. Thank You Best Western

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollylucyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in this Bestwestern hotel. We always stay at a B/W when in Rome, but this one was a mistake. Our room was very small and the shower door came off in my hands. Had to get dressed and call to have it fixed. The nieghborhood was in the Indian area of the city with many wholesale trinket stores. Had to walk many blocks for dinner. Next year back to B/W Universo. On the postive side the staff was pleasant and it was a short walk to the train.

Reviews.Title: “Our best experience by far on our trip through Italy”
Reviews.Author: GuyFromAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: We completed a 10 day, 3 city tour through Italy and this hotel was great. Our check-in went smoothly, our room was clean, fresh and large. The staff went out of their way to answer all questions about getting around Rome (our first visit to Europe). The breakfast buffet was fantastic and certain to please anyone. The area around the hotel was not the greatest, but we wanted to be close to the train station and expected as much. We walked right across the street to a farmers market for fresh fruits and great reataurants we all within walking distance. The subway was one block away and our gateway to all of Rome. This hotel was a great find for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shady part of town, close to subway/train”
Reviews.Author: LeMansGuy
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, and offers what every traveller would want in a nice hotel. The hotel was very clean, very well appointed, the rooms very clean, excellent bed, very excellent bathroom with bidet, good lighting, heated towel racks, a mini bar, good air conditioning. The staff were friendly and efficient. Breakfast in the morning was included and a very good selection of hot and cold items. Now, this hotel was in the middle of what appeared to be pakistantown/chinatown (I am not trying to be racist but simply descriptive). There were a LOT of men from the middle east and asia loitering around at all hours of the day, and there were no "Italian" restaurants around for several blocks. From an American tourist perspective, it was rather slummy in that part of town. If you can be aware and confident, it is only a 4-5 blocks (north or west) walk till you get to a more inviting area of town, just don't go southward. The Termini station is only 3 blocks away, and a metro subway entrance 1 block away, so it's quite convenient to get around town and to/from the airport. The prices were a bit high, but it was a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Dullege
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were proactive and excellent. Well-mannered and seemed eager to make other people happy. They easily processed my wife checking in well in advance of me which was very helpful. The front desk has info on the tours in the area, as well as which ones to avoid, and maps which were extremely helpful as well. The doorman carried both of my wife's bags to our room and gave her an in-depth orientation. The wi-fi was free and quick. Requiring a password for the wi-fi, the staff once again exceeded expectations and hand-delivered it to our door. The staff in the breakfast area were equally as pleasant to deal with. The breakfast was good and there was never a wait to be seated. There is no pool or fitness area, which is unfortunate, but that was mitigated by sweet air conditioning. The surrounding area is a borderline slum and the hotel is tarnished by sleeping drunks outside on the street. The surrounding does however offer some great cafes, bars and little restaurants. This hotel is located near a major transit hub, making inner-city travel a breeze. We would stay here again in a moment!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location to station, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: LP29
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not quite as close to the station as we'd originally thought, but still only a 10 min walk. The rooms were clean, if not very small. Free wifi was a bonus for our kids. Reception staff could work on their attitude, they were not very friendly, rude on occasions. that said, i would stay there again - if i was given a larger room with a bathroom I didn't have to walk like a crab in!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!! Would love to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: YogeshGoel
Reviews.Content: What do i have to say. Perfect in everything. This was our first hotel in our Europe tour and the first experience itself was mind-blowing. Simple loved everything they had in offer. Staff is very cooperative. This was the only hotel in our whole tour which had proper number of staff and waiters and people to work about. Whatever we asked was made available in our room. Good spread at the breakfast. It has all the amenities which you can think of. Perfect cleanliness and everything properly placed. The room we stayed in had a small balcony which had a great view. Internet, water heater kettle and such small small things really made things good for us. Simply loved to stay here and would love to come here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: VillaMTBMan
Reviews.Content: The rooms and staff were excellent. The metro wad just around the corner which we used every day and was only a few stops to many popular attractions. Bed was turned down each night & fresh towels each day. Only gripe was the shower being a bit on the small side. A bigger person would find it a squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “when i visit Rome again”
Reviews.Author: debashisr7
Reviews.Content: It is very near to station may be 5 minutes walk but not much of noise around. For any Indian food lovers , there are number of Indian restaurants around. Metro is just a minute away which makes the life very easy and comfortable. Room was excellent. Service was good. There was no restaurant attached to the hotel but the coffee shop has decent menu to take care of the need. Front office personnel were very courteous to help. This was my first visit to Rome. Over all my stay was comfortable and good.

Reviews.Title: “Rude frontdesk staff”
Reviews.Author: nemir
Reviews.Content: I checked in on the evening of July 10, I was surprise how rude was one of the check-in male staff he made me feel really uncomfortable for my entire stay We selected Best Western over any other hotels in Rome because of the good reputation of Best Western in General (from north American experience) which we were expecting same service level and proficiently as any other Best Western in North America but unfortunately we were wrong By the way this Best Western Hotel is an independently owned and operated so don’t expect the same level of service and proficiently to be like any other Best Western in North America

Reviews.Title: “Fun and relaxing way to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: beckhow
Reviews.Content: I was studying abroad and decided to take a tour of Pompeii that left out of Rome and needed a hotel to stay in for 2 nights. This hotel far exceeded my expectations and if I could have stayed their the remainder of my trip in Italy, I would have. The staff was exceptionally kind to me and so helpful. The breakfast was EXCELLENT. Spotless room. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: PeterWyn
Reviews.Content: A good hotel all round! Close to good restuarants and the main railway station (Termini) and transport hub (buses and trams). Rooms spacious and clean. Food good and plenty of it. Staff courteous and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritishIndianFamily
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was good value. When looking for a hotel within our budget £300 and at 4 star, i was limited to ones quiet far from central, or others with not great reviews. The advsisor recommended this, and i thought that the reviews on this website were good enough for me to go ahead. However approaching the holiday, got anxious when i saw soem reviews from other websites. I needed to not worry thought! We had our 9 year daughter with her so safety was important, travellign to centre, and breakfast with room quality. All of these were very good. The staff were brilliant. Very accomodating, pleasant and helpful. Spoke great english and gave us a tips on where and when to go and best times etc. The cafe down the road - milky bar - is their local, and it was great for lunch and snacks. Bedroom was clean, quite big for a european hotel, and all the amenities i needed. The sofa bed was big enough for 2 kids, although we just had the one. Breakfast was again very good, included regular european food, eg croissants, pastries ( large selection), hot food, cold meats and cheese, cereals and much more. Hence we had a good start each morning. The location albeit is in an ethnic area, i can imagine is daunting at night. However we had no problem! The location, hotel and price outweighed it. Metro, 2 mins away, although we only used once!! Train station nearby - never used. We found it easier and nicer to walk to the colloseum from hotel all 3 days and take it from there. 20 mins sounds alot, but actually my duaghter managed fine, and we got to take in the surroundings. Generally a lot of walking involved in rome, and we were up to the challenge. We used an audio guide for the colloseum - wouildnt recommend that - it was 5.50 but we did not like it. Would have preferred a guide - 5 euros per person, but every hour so we didnt bother waiting. Howver we were approached by several tour operators on the way to vatican, but chose to go with one who was great! He took us to the office where there was others, we all had a radio and although initial start was shaky, was worth spending 20 pound extra on top of 20 pound for the man. He was very helpful, saved ALOT of queuing and was worht every penny if not more - we gave a generous tip. Journey from airport was initially tricky. Planned to get train, then things got confusing so opted for taxi. However a taxi just for us was 85 euros, if you prepared to share iwht others, which we were, bought the bill to 45 euros. Took about 45 mins to get there with traffic. On the way back, it was only half an hour. Had some noise at nice, but staff did point out that it was roadworks and that it was unfortunate. Didnt stop us sleeping well though. All in all, although i was nervous AFTER booking my trip to best western, we had a great trip and the cleaniness of the htoel, comfortability and great breakfast and staff made it a great short break.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, COMFORTABLE, EXCELLENT SERVICE, SPOTLESS, & IDEALLY SITUATED FOR TRAIN & BUS”
Reviews.Author: Deborahmary
Reviews.Content: Veryfriendlystaff. Comfortable, bright, pleasant rooms, quite big.spotlessly clean, TV & teamaking facilities. Light meals were available in the bar until 10.30pm. We enjoyed pizza & lasagna, which were adequate as an evening meal, when we arrived back tired & footsore, after a long day sightseeing, . The breakfast menu was excellent, varied to suit all taste.The Ambra Palace is ideally situated near the Termini, for Metro 7 busses.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: rob_lipscombe
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Ambra Palace Hotel. Situated about a mile from the Colosseum it is ideally located for touring Rome. The Vittorio Emanuelle subway station is just 2 minutes away. The room was comfortable and well furnished and the huge double bed was also very comfortable. We found all the staff very congenial and helpful from booking taxis, recommending local restaurants and the best ways to get around. Although we didn't have dinner at the hotel, we did have breakfast every morning which was more than adequate. We would certainly consider staying at this hotel again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Alison2220
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenager children and I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel. It is conveniently located just a 2 or 3 minute walk from a Metro station and a 10 minute walk to the main Termini station from where one can get a coach to the airport for €6 (Terravision). We booked our holiday through Directline Holidays (www.directline-holidays.co.uk), a company that I would also recommend. The rooms were not huge, but perfectly adequate with a large cupboard. There was free Internet in the room. It is not wifi but the hotel provide a cable. A username / password is required. There is also a mini bar. The bathrooms had showers but not baths and there was a hair dryer. We were on the 4th floor and we slept well as the beds were comfortable and it was very quiet - even though we were almost directly opposite the lift. The breakfast was fine with a good selection of breads, cereals, yoghurts, cakes etc. There was also hot food including bacon, eggs, mushrooms and baby carrots. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful - booking restaurants for dinner and suggesting tours etc. This hotel, represents good value for money and I would be more than happy to stay there again if we were to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “This was a regrettable choice of a hotel for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Cl4rin3t
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married on July 10, 2010 and chose Italy for our honeymoon, which began on July 13, 2010. I was very impressed with the Ambra Palace Best Western Hotel on the internet, and chose that as our first honeymoon hotel. Upon arrival, I was somewhat surprised at the appearance of the surroundings outside the hotel, and that hotel parking was 5 blocks away. This became a problem during our checking-out process. When we checked in, with our 9 bags, we were informed by the manager and porter that we could leave the bags in the area of the hotel, past the lobby, and they would be brought up by the porter. I was a little hesitant about this, but was told they would be safe. All of the bags made it up to our room safely. However, when we were checking out, after our three night stay, we brought the bags back down to the exact same location. The lobby was not busy because it was Noon, and most of the guests had probably checked out earlier. The staff knew I was leaving the bags there because I had to walk 5 blocks to get the car (not stated on Best Western.com.) My new wife was sitting near the bags, in the area provided by the hotel. However, with all of that being said, during the 15 minutes it took for me to get the car and return, my camera bag, containing my camera, camcorder, copies of all of our credit card and passport information and 3 days of honeymoon pictures was stolen; right from the exact same spot in the hotel that was supposedly safe during our check in. We spoke to the manager who told us we should have watched the bags better, and that it was our fault. That confused me because the bags were safe in that same area while we were checking IN, and neither my wife nor I were with them because we were being escorted up to our room by the porter. After I scoured the entire bottom floor of the hotel, frantically searching for the camera bag, we were told by the hotel staff to go to the American Embassy and the police station to report the theft. Upon our arrival back to the hotel, several hours later, after reporting the theft and canceling all of our credit cards, I asked if we could view the hotel's security camera tape, which showed the coming and going of people in and out of the hotel. We watched it with the manager, from the time I left to go get the car, till the time we left to go to the US Embassy and police station. Most curiously, no one was seen leaving with the bag. The bag is quite large, and would have been easily recognizable on video. It leads to the obvious conclusion that whoever lifted the bag was quite familiar with the hotel's operations, thus avoiding the security camera. It stretches the imagination that no hotel employee witnessed anything unusual, given the low amount of lobby traffic at the time we were checking out. I was also told by the manager that there was no other way out of the hotel, except for the front door. The hotel manager, realizing our situation, offered us an additional night’s stay for free. He also assisted us with adjusting a few of our subsequent Best Western hotel reservations at other locations in Italy. Despite his gestures, my memories of our stay at the Ambra Palace hotel are as follows: We were violated at a time we thought we were secure at the Ambra Palace. We lost over $1300.00 US of photographic and related equipment during our stay at that 4-star "luxury" hotel. We lost 3 days of photos (perhaps 500+) and videos which are frankly not replaceable. We lost an entire day of our honeymoon, spending it instead at the US Embassy, on the phone canceling our credit cards and arranging for replacements, and at the police station. We had to cancel our Best Western Credit Card, which would have allowed us to receive points toward future hotel stays. We were unable to visit 2 destinations we had planned for our trip. Due to cancellation of our credit cards, and the resulting lack of available finances, we were unable to purchase souvenir gifts both in Rome and Venice, as we had planned, for our bridal party back home. We had no finances until we received a new credit card in Florence, 4 days later. In addition, canceling our credit cards and securing new credit cards with my cell phone cost over $110.00 Finally, we came away from our experience with a destroyed opinion of personal safety and security at Best Western Hotels. Over the past 12 years, we have visited Europe and had always chosen Best Western Hotels. Up until July 16, 2010 I had a very favorable opinion of Best Western Hotels. That being said, however, the events surrounding July 16, 2010 at your hotel were indefensible. As I stated on the phone, and in the email I sent to Best Western International, explaining my story in greater detail, the bags were not left alone. My wife was seated in the next room, with view of the luggage. It is correct that she was not sitting with the luggage, but there were no seats for her to sit on while she waited 15 minutes for me to get the car; the seats were in the next room. The luggage was placed in the exact spot that we placed it in upon check-in, when the porter took us up to the room, and no one was with the luggage, and it was safe. Had I known that there was no parking area at the hotel, I would not have chosen that place. The Best Western website states the Ambra Palace has a nearby garage. That garage is an 8-10 minute walk from the hotel. After reportedly looking into this sad situation, Best Western and the hotel itself refused to accept responsibility for what happened within their hotel to a customer. Either there are unscrupulous visitors to the hotel, or some individual who frequently is present in the hotel was involved in this theft. The hotel and their management effectively look the other direction in not taking responsibility for crimes within their walls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Great City”
Reviews.Author: CaptCamshaft
Reviews.Content: The Ambra Palace is very clean and tidy... the rooms are good and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is plentiful and varied continental, and there was loads of variety and choice. The location of the hotel is approx 10mins walk from the Termini, in an ethnic area; but the locals ignore you and we never felt threatened in any way. Our room was clean and well equipped with modern tasteful decor, bath shower and bidet and well stocked mini-bar. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anybody !!!

Reviews.Title: “top class 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: dec60
Reviews.Content: from the time we arrived the staff were top class, as we were checking in we where being told how to get around the city but not an in your face sale pitch, they did'nt try to sell us any tours like you mght expect when being told how to get around a new city fby a hotel. all the stafff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were small but very clean ideal when visting rome as you will most likly out all day

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: ScoobyPenistone_uk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 nights stay at the Ambra Palace and had a great time. Yes we could have stayed slightly more central but would have paid much more and this hotel is great value and a 4 star. The nearest metro stop is round the corner ie 2 minutes walk and the mainTermini train stn is only 10 minutes. Other reviews have questioned the area and I myself was a little unsure,but during our stay we had no problem, safe walking around and certainly did not feel any more uncomfortable than walking around any UK city if not been before. The staff very friendly,proffessional and the front desk very helpful. We had even arranged through them airport transfers and they were efficient and punctual.The rooms ( classic grade ) were clean , good size, nice shower etc.We were on the front of the hotel (room607) and a little noise from refuse collectors but nothing to spoil a nights sleep. The breakfast room I feel is a little small and can be crowded at times but we alway managed to get a table and continental breakfast great to start the day. A comfy pair of shoes required as you will walk some miles. WE booked the open top bus through the hotel and only 10 minutes walk to the termini to exchange our vouchers and get straight on the bus which is a great way to see the city. Take a trip over to Tratesvere area (south west of Vatican otherside the river) nice area at night with very reasonably priced food and wine and relaxed atmosphere. Overall I thought the hotel great, excellent value, good location . Rome is an amazing city with so much to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JanetDBelfast
Reviews.Content: The Ambra Palace is two streets over and to the left of Termini Station - a seven minute walk. It is at the slightly seedier end of Via Principe Amadeo, in an ethnic neighbourhood of mainly Indian, Chinese and Black residents. Ethnic bead/trinket/fabric shops abound and the hotel itself is opposite two large and colourful fruit & vegetable and fabric/handbag markets. There are many restaurants in the surrounding area of good quality and reasonable price. The hotel is clean, welcoming and friendly. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or nicer. The bedroom was a reasonable size with TV and minibar. The bathroom was very small, but adequate and immaculately clean. The breakfast was fine, with all the variety you expect from a continental-stye offering. We did find that the hotel bar was expensive - but then, no-one ever seemed to be in there anyway. The neighbourhood is quiet, but the locals tend towards the vocal - like all of Rome! The only really annoying disturbance we had was the delivery of the hotel laundry, which started about 4am on the Saturday morning and continued for about 90 minutes. We did not feel threatened in the neighbourhood, but you should be aware that the locals tend to congregate at night round street corners. A few stare at you sullenly and one or two may ask if you have a cigarette. The odd one will say hello. I fond them friendlier than the average Londonder. Certainly, we did not come across one unpleasant Roman during our trip - it is quite a friendly city. The hotel benefits from a great central location, with the Colosseum within a 15 minute walk and many fine churches and squares nearby. The Metro is one block behind the hotel and six stops down from the Vatican. We would have no hesitation in visiting again and our fellow guests - German, US and Japanese seemed to agree.

Reviews.Title: “excelent if you get the front view”
Reviews.Author: stefan87
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6 days and the room was very nice, the corner room on the first floor, with the view to the front of the hotel. we were fortunate that because the room was on the corner of the building we had windows on 2 walls of the room and one more window in the bathroom. all the rooms are very clean, very nice, but i recomend you the get one with the view to the front of the hotel in order to really enjoy your stay. the ones on the back are identical, but the view to tha back court and the single window takes away some of the pleasure of the stay. we had a standard double room. the breakfast is very decent, scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, melanzane, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great”
Reviews.Author: Lolo05186402
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, pleasnat and the staff were first class in their helpfulness and best of all, they were unobtrusive - when you needed them they were there, when you did not not, they left you alone. Nothing appeared to be too much to ask, at whatever time. I am not sure of the route some of the other reviewers took to Termini but it was literlally just up the road and very easy to get to. I am not the fastest walker but 5 minutes to get there sounds about right to me. I think that those who turn right out of the hotel may become worried about the neighbourhood as me and my friends were on our first day, since the area in that direction appears particularly run down. After that first journey,we always started our trips by turning right and ended up in a central location from which to start our day/ evening. We explored Rome, took a trip out to Florence and ate and drank to our hearts' content, again the hotel staff came in handy for booking excursions or simply getting directions to the sights. The breakfasts were always very fresh, with lots of variety and very tasty. Our room was a good size as three of us shared and our bathroom was in very good condition. Overall, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN BUT SO DEPRESSING - LOTS OF THE BAD SIDES OF ITALIA”
Reviews.Author: KtyKatParis
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms - though some stink cold cigarette. Nasty and despising personal, really unfriendly. Matresses are super bad, awful climatisation in the room that cannot be manipulated (but it's always your fault if you sleep in a fridge, because you could have called the reception at 3 am to solve the problem). smallest shower ever. OK breakfast in the morning with Nutella (good point!). Cold decoration. Great central location in Rome. Extremely expensive for what it is...

Reviews.Title: “Good link to Roma Termini, neighbourhood isn't very Roman though”
Reviews.Author: dimsum888
Reviews.Content: Roomwise was comfortable, size was average but the bathroom was adequate and came with a bidet and includes a minibar fridge - godsend in the hot weather, we bought drinks from the supermarkets (Spar at Termini). TV - limited English choices, only BBC World and CNN. Only so many times you can watch the same news report. Breakfast had a good spread and includes bacon/scrambled eggs/mushrooms amongst usual continental of breads, cheese and cold meats. We had our good fill each morning in the buffet service. Waiters come to clear your plate as well which is a nice touch. Location - great for being so close to Termini and the Leonardo Express but the neighbourhood is mostly for Asian immigrants, felt like Asia than Rome but that's the trade off. Tourist - front desk supplied us with maps and their "preferred" (read commission) Hop On/Hop Off bus - there are cheaper - look to Roma Termini, we saw one for a few euro's cheaper than what we paid and they all go round similar routes and we got a 48hr ticket. For internet - there is one computer for use but I brought my own netbook. Free wifi is in the lobby but the room had a wired ethernet cable which I could use. My Android phone didn't connect to the wifi as it needed popups to accept and log on. There's an Indian next door but there is one really great authentic Italian place nearby a few blocks- ask the concierge about La Vecchia, great authentic pizza (thin crisp base) for bargain price and traditonal Italian service. Brilliant reccomendation and a good meal on our last night in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: jetset2010_10
Reviews.Content: It was misleading to say that the hotel is a 5-minute walk to the Roma Termini Station. In sweltering heat we walked for more than 5 minutes. The Hotel Staff are so-so, not overwhelmingly friendly. I was itchy at night and wondered if there were bedbugs. When we returned to France and checked in to a new hotel I slept like a baby. The neighborhood location is filthy, depressing and teeming with by standers. There are no authentic Italian cuisine in the vicinity of the hotel and we would walk and circle the neighborhhod looking for one to no avail. The internet connection was a nightmare! And they only have one computer station. I sat for an hour waiting for my e-mail to pop up. Breakfast is so-so. It's definitely not a 4-star hotel! pretentious, misleading and overpriced. I am NOT coming back and will NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything great except the mattresses.”
Reviews.Author: traumac
Reviews.Content: I mean really. It's a nice little hotel not too far from major stuff in Rome. The front desk staff is superior! They gave us a free upgrade to a suite; nice! Some posts talk about the neighborhood being sketchy. It is not really and I am quite a xenophobe. Lots of working class immigrants from India (I think) and China. There are several phone banks so they can call family back home. Nice to see some nice work discipline, unlike what the current administration in Washington DC supports. The only bad thing is that the mattresses are rock hard. Pillows too. What a shame. Everything else was nice. Oh and the breakfast is not great. But you can always have Nutella, which it appears the Italians are addicted to. The service there is weak, had to beg for more coffee every day. Maybe this review does not sound great. But in fact, I would stay there again. It's clean and price is reasonable. Why waste money when you only really go there to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location !!”
Reviews.Author: rajeevclassic
Reviews.Content: The hotel okay, the staff friendly, the rooms just about okay, BUT BAD BAD location, totally avoidable if with family, clearly not a four star hotel, makes three star. The location kills the place. Avoidable for the rates the hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Andreakristine
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy and I had an amazing time. I had been warned about the small hotel rooms in Europe so I was prepared for this..... and it was true. Although our room was small (I believe some of the upgraded rooms are larger) it was very functional and met our needs for a week long vacation. In my opinion, the beds and pillows were a little firm but the front desk gave us extra pillows which helped with comfort. The room was quiet and cool. The breakfast is nice and has many options to choose from. The location of this hotel was the best feature. Although some call the area seedy, this was not my experience at all. (All of Rome has graffiti so do not that be the deciding factor.) The metro is literally around the corner from the front door and makes traveling in Roma easy and fast. I felt safe the entire time and we would often be out late (midnight) and still walk around with no problem. If you are looking for a great deal on a room I would recommend this hotel. We booked our entire vacation through Virgin Vacations and were very please with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: FoxAlaska49
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our expectations and then some! We were VERY suprised by the nice public spaces and excellent space and condition of our room. We had been warned about small hotel rooms in Europe, but were pleasantly surprised by the spacious and well furnished room we had. The front desk staff was truly amazing. They were professional, helpful and had great recommendations for restaurants and tour options. They even had a recommendation for a great little self-laundry that was just down the street. Breakfast every morning was a bonus. This hotel was a great value. We had read some of the reviews about the location and did not know what to expect. However we found the neighborhood interesting, VERY safe and we even met some interesting people. The location was also perfect for getting around Rome. We were near the Metro, close to the Colosseum and only about a $10 cab ride from all the other attractions we wanted to see. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in an ethnic neighbourhood, close to transport”
Reviews.Author: MistakenIdentity
Reviews.Content: First, ignore all the posts about strange foreign people; it's because this is a predominantly Chinese and Indian neighbourhood. They will not bite! There's nothing to be afraid of and it's fine at night too. However, there is a definite third world feel to the area, bordered with modern Italy near the station, two blocks away, a large park to the west and the nicer touristy area four blocks to the north. Highlights: - There's a market across the street with an amazing array of very fresh seafood, meat, and vegetables. Made me wish I'd rented an apartment instead! Another building houses the shoe, clothes and baggage stores. - For a number of blocks there are some very small store fronts selling basic convenience foods, what must be custom clothes stores showing very few items, and an electronics store next door. - The Termini station is a hub for all the buses, overground and underground transport. Beware, it's a bit of trek to the underground but we have optmized our route so that we were indoors for the rest of it. - At the station is a shopping mall, above and below. Don't buy from the Spar place - it's a tourist trap rip-off. Coke for 3 euros, which can be bought at the much nicer grocery store under the station; we went there several times to gobble up the local foods for lunch. - A park was nearby but we didn't really use it because it was so hot; however, just a little further south is a gigantic gelato & Italian ice shop called "palazzo del freddo". - Food was readily available in several ethnic groups - Chinese, expensive Korean, Indian and further north, a lot of Italian restaurants in the Termini area. Overall, I recommend this location for the sheer variety, it's not Italian but it's an insight to how foreigners have built up their own little town. Real Italy (tm) is just a stone's throw away so there's no need to pay, probably double to go just a few blocks north. The hotel is fine, breakfast got a bit dull but was essential to supply the energy for the rest of the day. We had some pretty nice, large rooms for our group so no complaints there. TV reception sucked in one of the rooms but we had our own entertainment anyway. Two foreign power supplies were at the desk which was nice and doubled my charging capabilities. One thing which truly sucked was the lack of wireless internet in the rooms, a crazy firewall system and a broken ethernet cable - a wireless router was not on my list of things to bring! Anyway, I just want to point out that just because some people look different, there is no need to be afraid!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GoutmanEliz
Reviews.Content: , spacious rooms and clean, helpful staff, hotel in a walking distance from the historical center. totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHATBangalore
Reviews.Content: We ( four of us) stayed here between 23rd to 25th April2010 and liked the place very much.The place is neat and clean.First day it was raining heavily and they provided us umbrellas so that we could go on Rome by Night tour. Being Indians, the best part is there are 3-4 restaurants serving Indian food nearby so that we could have homely food. breakfast was good. They have cute bar. friendly staff. It is very near to railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller999
Reviews.Content: Overall: It depends what you're looking for. If you want plush accommodations, then I wouldn't recommend this hotel. If you're looking for a mid-tier, basic place at a value, then this hotel fits the bill. Closer hotels that were slightly more money that I liked better were: Venetia Palace and UNA Hotel Roma. Location: Very close to Termini and comfortable walking distance to Colusseum/ Ancient Rome area. A little bit more of a hike (but walkable) to areas like Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. I didn't think this was a dodgy location at all, but I live in NYC, so I guess it depends on where you come from. Rooms: Definitely clean, but nothing great. My least favorite part was the bed, which had what I call "pancake pillows" that are quite flat. Sheets were thin.. mattress not very comfy. A GREAT bonus was free wifi in the room, which we did not find often in our other hotels in Italy. Bathroom was definitely fine. We had a shower/tub. Adjustable shower nozzle, good pressure. Comes w/ the usual bathroom amenities (shampoo, lotion, etc.) Breakfast: Very nice. Plenty to fill up on for the day. Staff: They were very nice. Not as stuffy as some of the other staff we encountered on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: elektrowerk
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night as a single female traveller, was upgraded to a huge superior room, the staff is extremely helpful and all very nice and always smiling. Decided to have breakfast in the room and it was twice as much as i thought it was going to be!!! On top of that they did not charge for the room delivery. Awesome stay, don't get put off by the local "fauna". Nothing dodgly going on in the evening, even on a saturday night!! Very pleasant, highly recommended!! Best bonus: free internet!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: DimitrisM2
Reviews.Content: Although in not such a good area in the city, nevertheless the people in the Hotel were most kind and excellent professionals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice tidy hotel, probably better”
Reviews.Author: JohnWoburn
Reviews.Content: No Bath, small showers. Nice bar area, breakfast was better than most. Staff were friendly enough. Chose this through BA airmiles. Probably could have picked better / could have picked worse. Rooms were well sound proofed and clean. Very popular.

Reviews.Title: “If you can - stay in a better area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shrewgr
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with everything the last reviewer ..... "Did we go to the same hotel".... states. We arrived late at night at the hotel and the surrounding area is very intimidating and dirty. Graffiti on walls, shop fronts and even on a parked vans and men standing at street corners , shop doorways watching your every move. Have a look on Google street map for evidence of the local surroundings!. When we got up the next day we were surprised to see the local police parked outside the hotel in 2 vehicles in what we later found out to be their regular parking slot..This was not a one off event and no prior explanation was given by the hotel management. Why park there ever working day if there are no issues? The hotel is fine and the daily maid service is first class.Our bedroom carpet however had seen better days and was dirty.To conclude - we were very disappointed with the hotels down market location and we would not recommend it to anyone.. Definitely not an area of Rome to take a leisurely walk in the late evening ! Nice hotel in the wrong location.A poor choice of development by the hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Did we go to the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: mendi
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I wonder if we went to the same hotel. The area is intimidating to say the least, no matter what race, color or ethnicity they are. We are not used to having men stand around drinking beer on the streets and I don't mean in outdoor cafes. Close to the train and bus station, YES and that is great, but..... THE AREA IS INTIMIDATING and I will not recommend for families with kids. A single business person coming in and going out from either the train or bus station and moving around the city in a cab is OK if you get the right price. Why are there two or three cars full of carabinieris in front of the hotel in the mornings? The restaurants in the area are tourist traps with mediocre food at best even if one great feature of the hotel is that it is right across the street from the food market which is always quite an experience and you always hope there is a restaurant owned by someone from the market with great food. Not the case. The hotel is clean, the service is good and it is close to the stations, but if you scare easily and want to be where you can walk around without looking over your shoulder, specially at night, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expected better”
Reviews.Author: trickytreeDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Ambra Palace.AS the hotel is near the bus terminal we caught a bus from the aerport which run frequently and it took about 10mins to walk to the hotel from the terminus.Nice clean rooms,with bed linen changed every day although unneccesary.Annoying tiny showers.If you're chubby you might struggle to pick the soap up again if you drop it! Friendly staff.Only average breakfasts in my opinion. Overall;good but not as good as some of the reviews on here.Some of you are easily pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice people”
Reviews.Author: manosSyros
Reviews.Content: Near Termini, nice, quiet, very clean. The breakfast was good. The staff very helpful - nice people with smiling faces. Although the surrounding area has a lot of immigrants we never had any trouble even at night. Near the hotel there is a small restaurant with exceptional indian food - if you like spicy food you have to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Leonardo Express.”
Reviews.Author: grotbags
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night pre cruise.The walk from Termini took a couple of minutes if you use the exit at platform 26 The hotel was clean and cool, staff were helpful and breakfast was fine. Our room was at the front of the hotel and there was no noise. We stayed here 7 years ago and the area seems to have improved since then.The metro and tram is just around the corner so sightseeing is easy. If you need to stay near Termini and do not mind using public transport,this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: sandygt1
Reviews.Content: Being it was our first trip to Europe, we can only compare our stay to the hotels in the US. The location of the hotel is nice being close to Termini station. The area is a little run down but we never felt unsafe. The hotel itself is comparable to a 2.5 or 3 star NYC hotel. Nothing really special about it. As others have noted, the breakfast was nice and got the days off right. The rooms were like an average NYC room. They did have AC but the showers were as small as those of cruise ships. We did not spend much time in the room so it was ok. I would not complain about the hotel but i would try another hotel if I went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: fin3222001
Reviews.Content: Very overrated for a 4 star hotel. This hotel is a borderline 3 star at best. The service is good, but the rooms are quite small. The air conditioning in the room was probably useless and had one setting - room temperature. The bathrooms were big but the shower door was barely a door - our bathroom floor got flooded every time there was a shower. The concierge is helpful, but everything else is nothing to go crazy about. Their lounge is just a bar and 3 small tables set up. An average hotel, but knowing that it's a four star hotel, it is definitely below par.

Reviews.Title: “Good value 4* hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Appsy59
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Rome which was a surprise trip for my partners fiftieth birthday, this being her first visit. I have used Golden Tulip hotels in other parts of europe for business purposes. They are generally of a good standard and the Ambra Palace is no different. From previous experience there is a good train service from Fumincino airport on the Leonardo Express which runs half hourly direct to Termini station for 11 euros. It is just a five minute walk from the station if you come off the train and take the first set of steps which bring you out of the station earlier than walking the length of the platform which we did on the way out. The hotel itself is clean and smart looking despite being in a bit of a run down area. Do not let the area put you off as it is very convenient for transport links, with Vittorio Emanuele Metro station a couple of minutes walk if you come out of the hotel and turn right and walk along via Ricasoli you come to Vittorio Emanuele Park with the entrance to the Metro. Back to the hotel, the rooms are quite spacious for Rome although the shower cubicle is a little on the small side despite the batroom being a reasonable size. I was fortunate that the room allocated was at the back of the hotel but cannot see it would be a problem at the front as the air conditioning was excellent. Breakfast was more than adequate with cereals, a small selection of hot food (mushrooms, scrambled egg and bacon) and the usual slection of cold meats, cheese and pastries. All in all would recommend this hotel as a good base for exploring Rome as long as you are prepared for a little extra walk or do not mind using the metro system

Reviews.Title: “Forget all the bad ratings about this hotel...read more”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 days here without any problem or inconvenience. Yes the hotel is 5 minutes walk away from the central (Termini) station and this is really handy because trains, metro and the main buss station are there as well. A train called "Leonardo" takes you from the airport "Fiumicino" (€ 11.00/person) in an half hour right to Termini and you will get off right at the exit to go to your hotel, very handy in deed! Buy a metro ticket for 3 days and you have access to "all" public transportation. In front of the hotel there's an "in building" market, worth visiting. Yes in the hotel neighborhood there are a lot of Asian people, all are in one or the other way related to plenty of Chinese wholesale places in that neighborhood, and NO these neighborhood id not dangerous just because there's Asian people around (you better watch for pick-pockets from other ethnic groups!). Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was OK, and as much as you wanted to eat. We experienced no excessive noise in or outside the hotel. Room cleanliness was 100%, only there head pillows are to thin and hard at my opinion, but.... Now last comment about Rome; this city is one large museum, lot to see, lots of walking if you want to see beaucoup. Take the effort and buy a good city tourist guide to not miss worthwhile "must see" spots. A city bus tour (open roof buses) is recommended for the first day, then start your journey on whatever you selected to see. There's plenty of restaurants, pizzerias, trattorias and alike, but believe me 99% of them will screw you one way or the other (laugh). A must is also to visit the most famous gelateria named Giolitti, they sell eventually 500kg of ice cream each day...go for it. Romans are nice people and the majority can express themselves in some English, so no problem on that side either. Enjoy Rome..... Egon Klein

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing all Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: ArthurStaaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights here and were very pleased. This was our first (and hopefully not last) visit to Rome. A ten minute walk from Termini to the hotel was very handy. We had been told we would get a room on the inner court as we had heard it can get noisy on the street. We arrived early, so we took the first room available - on the street. At times it got a bit noisy, but never all that bad. The rooms are small by US standards, but comfortable. We had a slight problem with breakfast on the first day. It came with our reservation, but the hotel didn't have a record of it. This was quickly cleared up. The breakfast is great and for budget travellers like us, helped us cut down on our food spending. Eggs and bacon - as well as the mushrooms - were greatly appreciated, along with fruit, bread, croissants,and assorted other sweets. After we picked this hotel, we were concerned by some of the reviews about the safety of the neighborhood. It looks a bit rough around the edges, but we never had any problems. I can't understand how anyone would have any concern during the day - unless they just plain did not like seeing a lot of working immigrants. This didn't bother us. At night, it might be intimidating to some people who just aren't used to rough-around-the-edges sections of big cities. We weren't out until the wee hours, but it was fine up until 9:30 or 10:00 at night. Overall we had a really good experience at the Ambra Palace and would recommend it to budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: rbwii
Reviews.Content: While I will try to be brief, potential guests should know that this hotel is in a sketchy neighborhood and employees are unhelpful and rude. We booked 2 rooms through Hotwire and when we arrived, they told us that we could only have one person per room - otherwise we would need to pay an additional E100. Our hands were tied! (we are in the process of getting the money refunded from Hotwire but it has been a tedious process) DO NOT let the hotel arrange cabs or tours for you (along with airport transfers) as they take a deep cut - and it is ALWAYS much more expensive than if you did it on your own. We paid E20 for a short cab ride to Trastevere - the cab called/flagged by the hotel - and only E11 to get home. The cab driver went to the front desk and was handed some sort of paper - it was shady and we were ripped off. Also, don't be fooled by some of the reviews as the hotel staff adds their own. Stay away - there are so many options when in Rome and this should not even be considered. Feel free to sent me a message if you have any specific questions!

Reviews.Title: “Travellers BEWARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: smurfberrymuffin
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff obviously pads the good responses for this hotel. Busy and loud location on end of dark street. Management is uncooperative and eager to take advantage of tourists using aggressive and intimidating methods.

Reviews.Title: “Deceived and Cheated”
Reviews.Author: ciao1977bella
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy hidden fees, a staff that makes excuses and clearly does not care then Golden Tulip Ambra Palace hotel is the right place for you and your family. First, upon arrival my family was warned not to walk around the hotel at night by our cab driver. Then, upon staying at the hotel we were provided a information about services (i.e. breakfast, shuttle, etc.) that were printed as being free. When were sideswiped by many many "hidden fees" the staff said and I quote "Those pamphlets are from four years ago and out of date". Upon further pressing the issue I was told that they were not responsible for the misinformation. That was printed in their pamphlets. That it applies to some packages not to others. It does not specify this in the pamphlets that it is a per package. Also, the hotel provided shuttle costs more by a significant amount then the cabs from the airport. The staff was aloof and did not care. In fact one staff member had the audacity to laugh at my sister as she was walking away after attempting to have a calm conversation about the matter. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money! Great Location, very good service!”
Reviews.Author: yiapa
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers all the needs when you go for a quick visit to a new town. Very good location, close to main train station and subway stop and within walking distance to major attractions. Room was quite small but very clean and newly renovated. Staff was very friendly and breakfast was within normal standards. Hey, when you go to Rome you are going to see the city attractions and not to stick to food! Neighbourhood was not that good but that did not affect in any means our stay. Strongly recommend this hotel. Y.P. - Cyprus

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 3-Day Stay in Feb '09 (With Children)”
Reviews.Author: FamilySightseeing
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay Feb 16-18th and had a wonderful experience. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, hotel was very well kept and (one standard and one "superior") rooms were immaculate. Crib was set up in large room; staff even offered to wash baby bottles for us (a huge help!). Needed toiletries were available and offered free of charge by the front desk. Bar staff was friendly and efficient, bellhops were courteous, breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Location is VERY convenient, both to Termini station and a Metro stop literally on the same block. We had been concerned about some reports on the neighborhood - ridiculous. Neighborhood is fine, hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend it to my friends”
Reviews.Author: bradenob
Reviews.Content: Three nite stay. Staff VERY friendly and helpful. Recommended a great restaurant right up the street - we ate there twice!!! (Ciceo). Room was fine, shower was small, bed was nice. Free internet use was handy, and they gave complimentary drinks. Very near the railway terminal, and the Metro station was just behind us. In the room they had one appliance plug that didn't need a converter - nice touch. They had CNN and Fox news in English on TV. I read comments about the neighborhood being a little worrisome - we never felt worried or threatened. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, regarding change of booking date”
Reviews.Author: angrynorwegian
Reviews.Content: We tried to change the date for the booking and they want to charged us for 3000 NOK (250 EUR). The cost for 1 night for each person (we was 4 person) The date for the booking was 3 months before the date for our travel. We should not cancel the trip only change the date.

Reviews.Title: “really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvvacurry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and got a lovely superior room for no extra cost. It had a kingsize bed, a jacuzzi bath (albeit quite small), a sofa bed for our son, a parquet floor, a beautiful rug and lovely sumptious looking curtains. Tea and coffee supplied, but make sure you ask for extra milk as what they give you is only enough for one cup per person per day. It was a little noisy outside our room as it overlooked the street below and the local traders, but it added to the atmosphere. The hotel was immaculate, but the bar food and drinks were very expensive: 6.50 euro for a small glass of prosecco and 5.50 euro for a small beer. Complimentary drink on arrival though. Staff were friendly and service was very good. We were given a free map on arrival by the reception and they told us where to visit and how to get there. The breakfast was nice - lots of pastries, meat, cheese, veggies, breads, yoghurts, but the fruit came out of a tin! The japanese style soup for breakfast was quite nice. Coffee was delicious, especially with the warm milk they give you. The hotel is really handy for the main station and for the Vittorio Emmanuele metro and is in a really ethnic area. The indoor market opposite was huge and absolutely unbelievable. Local shops are authentic indian or chinese and water and provisions are really cheap compared with the more central areas. Avoid the 'fast food' indian restaurant a few doors up - the head waiter almost bullied us into buying things off the menu that we didn't want so he could bump up our bill, but we were trapped as our son was quite poorly and we didn't want to go too far from the hotel. The food wasn't that plentiful or that good either. Overall a really lovely hotel and I would recommend it for comfort, quality and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Close to Vittorio Emanuele Subway Station”
Reviews.Author: ds20e
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our travel agent who herself stayed here a few months before. Here are our observations: 1. Nicely functional King bed room with mini-bar and electric kettle for instant coffee. Closet had plenty of space, hangers, a safe to store valuables, and a spare blanket and pillow. Overnight, the room was very quiet. 2. Lights to the room are controlled by the room key in the special slot of the room (bellhop will explain how to use it when you check in). Lights will initially turn on for a few minutes when you enter the room, but to keep them on, you have to keep your key placed in this slot. There were multiple times I forgot to do this and found myself in the dark all of a sudden about 5 minutes after I entered my room. 3. A wide staircase was by the elevator, much appreciated. It allowed us to exit the hotel without having to wait for the elevator (wait time was not bad either, though). 4. The hotel offers a private car shuttle to the Da Vinci airport. It costs 50 Euros but we were a few people and decided to try it. The driver arrived exactly on time with a fairly large car and we got to the airport quite quickly without any problems. 5. Going anywhere in Rome was easy using the subway. The (Line A) Vittorio Emanuel station is around the corner of the hotel. You can buy a multi-day pass from a self-service machine at the station for best value. 6. As the Termini train station is large, walking to it is quite close if you enter Temini by one of its side entrances (if you use the main entrance it will take about 10 minutes to get there). In there, you will find a whole shopping area for essentials and souvenirs. They charge 1,60 Euros to use the bathrooms in there but it was very clean. 7. Our room rate did not include breakfast but we decided to pay extra and try it one morning. If you are from North America, you will be quite disappointed. The scrambled eggs tasted like powdered yolk, the bacon was very greasy. and they seemed to easily run out of things like juice and toast. All this for up to 30 Euros per person in a fairly small banquet room. When we finished, we noticed there was now a line for people waiting for an empty table. 8. The bathroom had a hair dryer, lighted shaving mirror, toilet, bidet, and shower (no bath). Water pressure was nice and strong. 9. The room has an Ethernet cable for free internet access for a laptop. They also had a public computer in the lobby area if you did not bring a laptop. In either case, get an account from the front desk to get access to the internet. 10. The staff was very helpful and spoke English quite well. They even recommended a reasonably priced trattoria to eat a few blocks away on the same street (Il Cecio). 11. I don't know if this is hotel policy, but we received a coupon for complimentary welcome drinks at the bar located near the lobby. It was most welcome after having been travelling most of the day to get to Rome. 12. All phone calls from the room are charged. They do have a complimentary phone at the front desk if your number does not work. There are pay phones either on the street or at the Termini train station as an alternative. 13. The temperature in the room can also be controlled by the front desk. We tried using the thermostat in the room but we found the room too hot no matter which setting we tried. The front desk staff remotely turned off the heat to our room at our request, which helped. 14. The TV was a standard 20-inch set, with various channels including RAI, Fox News, National Geographic, and one in German.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: jmcroke
Reviews.Content: Jim & Mary from Cork Ireland. My wife and i stayed in this wonderful hotel in february.From the first moment we arrived we were made very welcome by the wonderful staff.The location of the hotel is very central and ideal for walking to all the sights.The bar is a bit expensive but is cosy.The breakfast was very nice and plentiful.Couldnt find anything wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of many”
Reviews.Author: Goncalo2008
Reviews.Content: The Palace in the name appears to be an overstatement, and so are some of the previous reviews. The Ambra Palace is one of the dozens of small hotels located around Termini station. My stay there, for only 1 night, didn't encounter any problems - but I found odd that, as I discovered when I arrived home, they had charged my credit card even before I checked in. The breakfast is rather basic. I chose the hotel based on its rate and proximity to Termini, and I don't see any other reason to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rome HQ”
Reviews.Author: wiscomilker
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay here (after about 5 years). Just as before, no complaints, service above avg.: clerk was very helpful arranging rooms at sister hotel in Florence, help freindly & efficient, rooms v. nice but not over the top....Complimentary drink at the bar always a hit, free internet (at desk off of lobby) very useful. Breakfast buffet above average & consistantly good. Last night there it rained & the restaurant/staff was a bit overwhelmed with the number of guests sticking around, otherwise would have given a 5 rating...... Neighborhood may not be for everyone, but to me just an interesting part of town - I believe old produce/wholesalers neighborhood (now mix of Pakistani & a bit of a China town) Improved some from 5 years ago, but just a great location for access to the train station and colosseum & metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: POTTERS-LONDON
Reviews.Content: Although the Ambra Palace is not in the best area of Rome, 5 mins walk away and the sights of Rome are upon you. The hotel was a lovely place to stay, small very friendly clean and nice decor. I can recommend this to anyone to stay at in Rome, but remember for Rome you will need good walking legs. Five minutes walk from the station and five mins from the city 'Hop on Hop Off Bus'.

Reviews.Title: “cheerful and cute”
Reviews.Author: MelissaD87
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed at ambra palace for 3 nights and we had a very enjoyable stay. I found the room wasn't massive but it was big enough for the amount of time we were staying, and seeing as we'd only be sleeping there, I had no complaints. Breakfast was nice with quite a bit of selection. The hotel itself seems to be in an asian/chinese district of Rome but we had no trouble whatsoever walking around at night and managed to find a nice italian restaurant nearby. The hotel is in the ancient part of the city so dotted around are parts of the old aquaduct system and the colleseum and forum are within walking distance. There's a metro stop nearby aswell but we were too lazy so we got taxis everywhere! The big termini station is about a 10 mins walk. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and booked tours for us with a local company which I think were good value for money, especially the vatican tour.

Reviews.Title: “great position- quiet area”
Reviews.Author: NelsonKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in May .It is situated a short walk from Romes Central Station and very close to a metro line.The Metro takes you to all the principal sites .We had a street facing room on the 5th.Floor and were surprised that despite the guidebook warning us that Rome was a noisy city that it was very quite. The room was comfortable with a large double bed , clean and they also provided tea and coffee . The decor in the room and hotel was of a high standard and the building itself is pleasing to the eye. There is a small bar and restaurant both of which we used. Breakfast self service but of excellent quality and quanity The reception area was welcoming and the staff helpful. Having stayed in many hotels on the Continent this was certainly above average and we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Rome”
Reviews.Author: Geowanderer
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, well-run hotel with helpful staff. Not the most attractive location, but convenient for public transport and walking distance to Termini platforms. No dinner restaurant, but coffee and drinks in the bar a high point before bedtime. Breakfast caters for most tastes and very efficient. Would readily return to explore more of Rome from this base.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gemael
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not fancy but is confortable and worth what it costs. The only aspect we didn't enjoyed very much was the location. The neighborhood is not welcoming (despite being safe during the day) but after a ten minute walking you reach the colosseum and forget that piece of the city.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: alan_b1
Reviews.Content: bit of a trek from the railway station than you expect - no way is it 200m - however here is a Metro stop just 50m away so the location is perfect if you don't expect to have the main sites on your doorstep. Nothing much in immediate surrounding area however if you want the Trevi fountain at 50m, expect to pay double the rate of this hotel. Rooms are clean, failry modern, and a good size. Not much closet space so if you don't travel light, be warned. Good value and location, would return here.

Reviews.Title: “a true palace”
Reviews.Author: weewheelsbelfast
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great the food and service was first class. the area looked a bit run down but dont be put of some great eating places on the same street

Reviews.Title: “Superlative service here !”
Reviews.Author: TJDSwansea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights at the Ambra in May 2008. We specified a top floor , quiet room with a pleasant outlook. The room we got on the 6th (top) floor was indeed very pleasant and no complaints .... except we had an adjoining door to the next room. Although it was locked , we were unfortunate to be sited next to a couple with a 2-year old girl who was out-of-control and noisy. She persistently rattled the communicating door and took great delight in screaming out loud. Having been woken at 3am on our second night there , enough was enough ! We complained at reception and were moved to ............... a superior room, at no extra cost. This was indeed superior ! ..... polished wood floor , settee and jacuzzi bath ! The service at the Ambra was faultless. The hotel is 15 minutes walk to the termini and , although it is sited in Little India (!! ) , there is a Piazza a few minutes away which you can stroll round , complete with shops , cash machines and bars. There are decent restaurants nearby and the Trattatorio Cecio , which we ate in was very reasonably priced and very good quality and situated on the same road as the hotel 10 minutes walk away. Breakast at the hotel was very varied and plentiful and even gave the option of bacon , scrambled egg and mushrooms - not of superlative quality , admittedly ! A word of warning though ! The drinks prices are extortionate ! We were given two complmentary drinks on our first night there and we chose vodka & tonic and a campari & soda. On our last night there , we decided to have a drink in the bar before we went out to eat. We chose the same drinks and the price ? ... 9.50Euros each !! All in all , we were very pleased with our stay at the Ambra and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Well |Done!!”
Reviews.Author: gattyou
Reviews.Content: Restaurants - Excellent Room - Marvellous Hotel - Central Hospitality is smashing. Indeed I will go nowhere but there should I go to Rome again Carmelo Gatt Malta

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money at Ambra”
Reviews.Author: Oldgitontour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walkable from the main Termini and close to a market, but during our stay, it closeness to the market did not detract from our stay. It was clean, bright, the rooms well-furnished and comfortable, and staff were very polite, helpful and knowledgable of their city and what it has to offer. We had half board, and the breakfasts were extensive. Meals were available in the hotel, but we did not eat there ourselves. We walked from the hotel to all the main sites, although there is a metro station in the square behind the hotel, which is less than five minutes walk. We had conflicting advice before we arrived about staying near the railway station,as, like many cities, the main station apparently attracts some of the rough elements. Well, frankly, compared to London, we felt safe walking about, and as long as you approach Rome the same as any other city, and act and carry goods sensibly, no problemo. The are a few Asian and African premises near the hotel, but we felt it added to the location. Plenty of places to eat nearby, especially up towards Termini on the west side, with numerous cafes bars tavernas, restaurants, a couple of Chinese and Indian places to choose from. All in all we found the hotel very good value for money, very comfortable and in a good location for us, a middle aged cynical couple from South London who have been around a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OttiCo
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Ambra Palace. The rates are relatively sensible, rooms are nice, clean and not too small, staff is nice, breakfast is great. Internet access is complimentary. The only minus is the location - it's not right smack in the center of town. But there's a Metro station right behind the hotel. I travel to Rome quite often on business, and whenever possible I will try to stay at this hotel. I just hope the great reviews I see here won't go to their head and make them raise their prices...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jatpa4087
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Rome. Stayed at the Ambra Palace after reading the reviews in TripAdvisor and have not regrets at all. The Golden Tulip Ambra Palace is a great hotel. Service is excellent. Staff are really multuilingual and they do not rest to make your stay a pleasant one. They are always willing to help and do it with a big smile no matter you ask for assistance. We reserved a standard room, so we were prepared for a small room. The room was small but for a week was not a problem at all. I have been in different European countries before and hotel rooms are small, no matter what type of hotel you select. At the Ambra Palace I checked one of their superior rooms and those are definitely larger. So, if you want a bigger room, then pay more. The bathroom of the standard room was spacious. The hotel and room were very clean. Breakfast (included) was great. They have a large variety of pastries, drinks, fruit, cereal, hams, cheeses, eggs, bacon, vegetables...etc., etc. etc. Try their croissants!!!!! Molto benne! The area is not dangerous at all. We walked at night for dinner and never felt threaten. It is a multiethnic neighborhood so you see people from many other countries. There are restaurants, trattatorias, cafes, pizzerias, all at walking distance. From the hotel you can walk to the Colloseum, the Metro (very reliable) station is around the corner, and Termini Station is a few blocks away. Overall, it was a great stay. If I go back to rome, will definitely considered the Ambra Palace again...no questions about it.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: smm0620
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Ambra Palace I would have to say what a lovely hotel it was with friendly and helpful staff. On our arrival the Reception staff went through all the places to visit on a handy little map, which came in very useful when out and about sightseeing. Our 'standard' room was spacious, clean and met all our requirements. The morning breakfast staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble, as where the bar staff who made a very nice cappucino, at a cheaper price then most of the local cafes! We had read some reviews of the hotel before our visit, and, as it was our first to Rome, we were unaware of particular areas of the city so did take reviews into consideration.
