Many had commented on the area and that they felt 'unsafe' walking out at night, I have to say that this was never the case during our stay, we actually arrived into Termini station quite late in the evening and walked to the hotel, stopping to ask for directions in a local shop, who could not have been more helpful, We would certainly return to the hotel the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've stayed in yet”
Reviews.Author: BobMan1134
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel, 5 star hotel. DO NOT listen to reviews that say bad neigborhood. It does have immigrants but not threatening or imposing. We had no problem walking at night. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. As soon as we got there, service was amazing. Staff all speak English and are more than friendly. They go out of there way to help you with anything you need. Hotel and rooms are clean and their complimentary buffet is excellent. Close to most attractions and there are alot of amazing restraunts nearby, the best in my opinion is Cecio's. Also near Termini so it is easy to get to anywere you need. Room size is normal hotel size, and the bathroom has a jacuzzi. This was the best Hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: celtictigerNyc
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the hotel is clean. It is not upscale but if you get a good price (I did) it is a great value. The neighborhood is also not upscale but very convientant near Termini. There are great local reasonable priced restaurants (Cecio) and supermarkets used by locals.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cheshiretourist
Reviews.Content: Smart helpful staff, nice and comfortable with good bar and breakfast facilities. Not in the best of areas but things change dramatically when you walk through the doors.Convenient for the central station and close by is a station for the underground railway. We walked to most of the Places of Interest from the hotel. Places to eat in the evening are a ten minute walk up the street.

Reviews.Title: “~Generally Good”
Reviews.Author: pentangle99
Reviews.Content: A little further from Termini than we were expecting - a good 10 minute plus walk. When walking down Via Principe Amedeo towards the hotel, there is a section in the middle labelled Piazza something. Don't panic, just keep going and Via Principe continues after a block - Weird! Its a quieter area away from the lights, but we did not feel particularly threatened. Rooms were on the small size, but adequate. We got there at 11pm and check in was so slow that I was concerned that our booking had gone astray. Breakfast was included and quite adequate. The welcome drink - choose what you like in the bar - was a nice surprise. Some bar prices were a bit steep eg Gin and Tonic about E10 so choose your free drink well. Generally a reasonable quality, reasonably priced hotel (we paid E95 per room per night), with quite a good location. Check out was a bit of a hassle as we had been charged E13 for each of two 1/2 bottles of wine whereas that was the price for a full bottle. E7.50 each should have been the price. The guy at the desk was initially disbelieving ie you signed for it, then unhelpful - you will have to see the barman when he comes in. We held our ground and eventually he went off, saw someone and got it authorised. This all took quite a while and was unnecessary aggravation - do they really think someone is going to this length to scam them for E11 when their total bill is E450! We would go back though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brockport
Reviews.Content: Location:excellent: 5 blocks from Termini and major bus/ train connections, 1 block from the Vittorio Emanuel B line metro stop. The neighborhood is filled with interesting Asian shops and a wonderful open food market is right across the street. Hotel staff: excellent service. They were extrordinairly alert to the needs of first time vistors to Rome providing maps, first internet service ,walking directions and recommendations for local sights. Breakfast room was a treat with a healthful buffet provide every morning. Again the staff there were friendly and helpful. For example, the buffet table had a Japanese broth available and Carlos cheerfully explained the ingredients in the delightful "pick me up." Rooms: warm, clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: wiky
Reviews.Content: I spent three days in Roma and thought every moment this hotel was a good choice. Very close to the railway and underground station, it was very easy to go everywhere. The front desk staff was very friendly and polite.They even suggested me a very useful path to visit the town. Breakfast was delicious and fresh. Room was nice, comfortable and really quite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: TwoGirlsTraveling
Reviews.Content: The Ambra Palace is a great hotel in a terrible neighborhood. Taking a taxi from Termini station, I was downright fearful as we pulled up to the hotel, but found a beautiful oasis inside. The room was clean, modern and roomy (Room 112), with a large (6 foot by 10 foot) walk-out balcony that would have been lovely for a spring visit. This made up for a shower stall (no tub) smaller than those you find on a cruise ship. The breakfast was among the best we sampled on this trip (5 hotels), with american offerings such as scrambled eggs and bacon, japanese offerings and lots of fabulous criossants (even better than those we had in Paris), meats, cheeses and (inexplicably) a number of desserts. The staff provided impeccible service, arranging for tours, recommending excellent restaurants and scheduling our transportation to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: glitterqueen888
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a tripple room as part of a group. The room was a bit small for 3 people, but it was nice and clean and the bathroom quite large and I enjoyed the jacuzzi bathtab! The breakfast served had a nice variety and the hotel staff was friendly and helpfull in every possible way! As a group we had also booked dinner, which was good, although we were not offered much salad. The hotel location was good, next to metro station, eventhough the area arround was not very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel-small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Narrabeam
Reviews.Content: Room was unusual shape & fairly small. However, there were plenty of wardrobe space & a decent bathroom. Maid service good-rooms clean etc. €200 a night for a room though, but Rome is pricey. Situated in a slightly less desirable part of town at night. However, Metro nearby & all sights walkable. Staff were first class though, helpful in every way, very efficient. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the room size”
Reviews.Author: bexj
Reviews.Content: Good first impressions, friendly door staff and receptionist. Room was very small, disappointing for nearly €200 per night. If you opened the wardrobe door you couldn't even squeeze past as the bed was in the way, the bathroom was so cramped that if you wanted to sit on the toilet you had to make sure the shower door was open, and you had to step over the bidet to get to the toilet. It would have been very difficult for anyone with any kind of mobility problem. The mattress on the bed was absolutely dreadful - rock hard, and the pillows weren't much better. The room was however spotlessly clean and well made up each day. Like other reviewers, we had no problems with the immediate vicinity, although we are used to living and working in areas like this - I would imagine it would terrify my country-bumpkin parents! The proximity to the Metro was fantastic, and it meant that a short hop could take you to some areas where there were nicer bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bickley
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and the fact that it is in the red Michelin guide, and we were not disappointed with our four night stay. The room was an odd shape but it was clean and comfortable enough, and the bathroom was spacious and well-appointed. The hotel had a pleasant bar and the room had a safe and plenty of storage space. Breakfast was a decent buffet and I found all the staff to be pleasant and efficient. Several other reviews have commented adversely on the area: it was very scruffy but so is much of Rome outside of the main tourist areas. I didn't feel unsafe: perhaps the complainers were unsettled by the fact that it is in a neighbourhood of Asian shops whose shutters are covered in graffiti. (The other side of the railway tracks was a different story. We ventured there in search of a Michelin recommended restaurant. We arrived too early for dinner and were not minded to go to a bar to await the 8.30 pm opening as we would usually have done. Fodor describes the area as counter culture/artsy: my assessment is more like squalid, worse than any other area I have seen in a major West European city. There were a lot of vagrants near the railway track and I wouldn't have felt comfortable walking back to the hotel late at night.). The Ambra Palace is a 5-10 min walk from the main railway station (convenient for trains to the aiports) and very close to a metro line. A downside of the area is the lack of good restaurants: we weren't impressed with the other Michelin rated restaurant we tried and although there is a Michelin starred place nearby it doesn't put its menu outside: if I am paying big bucks I like to know what is on offer before I go in. However, I would like to endorse the recommendation of other reviewers: Cecio, up the street from the Ambra Palace was a very good local restaurant patronised by locals as well as tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazbee
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Golden Tulip in June this year. We chose it carefully after reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor and also getting excellent feedback from our Travel Agent. We were initially concerned about the location - some of the reviews gave the impression that it was in a seedier part of Rome and that it's proximity to the Termini could be a problem, especially at night. While it's true that Rome isn't the tidiest city we've been to, we had no problems whatsoever with the local people around the Hotel. At no time we were approached or made to feel uncomfortable and even coming home late in the evening the story was the same. Just take the usual traveller precautions, be sensible and aware. The Hotel was fabulous! A real gem and such a find. The staff were friendly and accommodating and the welcome drink at their very cute bar was a lovely addition. Nothing was too much trouble and our room was large, clean and quiet (and we were on the front street!). The buffet breakfast (included in our rate) was an array of food both hot and cold and the service considerate even when they were literally overflowing with hungry guests. They are located within walking distance to the Termini Station and a semi-supermarket and also only a 10 minute walk to pick up coach tours including the Hop On, Hop Off Bus which was nice - although for most tours we were collected from the Hotel. Reception also organised a private car to pick up and drop us off at the airport - a luxury that worked out only a few euros more than a taxi and gave us a sleek, airconditioned ride in a spanky clean car with a polite driver. So worth it! Congratulations to the staff at the Golden Tulip - we were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: stevetracey
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel last minute through Expedia. Yes it is in the ethnic area but we did not encounter any difficulities. We travelled with our 11 year old son. The Hotel is very close to the Termini and Metro which is great for getting around. If you like Indian/Chinese food there are restaurants close by. Our hotel room was a triple and very spacious with a jacuzzi bath. It was very clean with a fridge, mini bar and coffee making facilities. The bathroom is well equipped with twin sinks, hairdryer and bidet. The bar is very sweet and the free drink on arrival is a nice touch. Breakfast was ample including pastries, fresh fruit/yoghurt and some hot selections. We even managed to see the Pope at the Vatigan on Wednesday morning. Apparently when in Rome he makes an appearance on Wednesday mornings which was a bonus. IThe only thing I wouldnt recommend is the time of year we chose to go. It was around 40 degrees and difficult to see all the sights in such unbearable heat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ambra Palace”
Reviews.Author: RSVPTraveler
Reviews.Content: A nice comfortable hotel with very nice staff. Very close to Termini, you can walk there. The beds are very comfy and the breakfast is great, not just cereal! The subway is also just a block away. There is a great market (fesh food,fruit, veggies,etc. on adjacent corner). Sorry, no pool or hot tub. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: The2Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: All we can say is that Ambra Palace Hotel was the best hotel that we've ever been in. The service was out of the ordinary, absolutly at it's finest ! All the 3 rooms that we lived in were very clean and tidy and the rooms were decorated in a simple nice fashion. The hotel is located near subway and is conveniently with in walking distance to the Colosseum, the Basilica of San Giovanni in Laterano and the Opera House. The location of the hotel is a matter of opinion. The Termini trainstation is very close to the hotel but it was never a problem. Yes, there were immegrants and other lessfortuned people around Termini trainstation but it is a myth that they appear hostile. In no way were we feeling any discomfort walking around Termini. Really worth the money and time ! So if your planing a trip to Rome and want to stay at a nice hotel, I would recoment Golden Tulip Ambra Palace Hotel ****

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MWF00
Reviews.Content: The Ambra Palace is a modern hotel in a covenient location close to Termini station. The hotel is very well furnished and maintained and has a very cosy and inviting bar next to reception. The welcome drink offered on arrival was a very nice touch! Our room, although quite small, was extremely comfortable and clean with all mod cons. The toiletries were different and of a high standard - another nice touch! I must compliment the maids who clean the rooms as they did an excellent job and again another nice touch was the evening turn down service. The buffet breakfast was fabulous with a huge variety of choice. We booked this hotel via the internet (not directly with the hotel) and obtained a good rate which makes this hotel extremely good value for money considering the standard and the little extras included. Ok, so the location is not so perfect but if this hotel was located more centrally then I am sure that the room rates would not be so reasonable. I would say that their main competition is the SAS Radisson which is just over the road. If you are staying in Rome during the summer months then I would suggest staying at the SAS as they have a magnificent roof top pool. To be honest, summer is not the best time to visit Rome. Our previous visit was during December - the weather was still good, there was far less tourists, traffic, queues. The one thing that has put me off Rome is the amount of dog mess on the streets - are they trying to compete with Paris??

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ANW72
Reviews.Content: We were overall very pleased with this hotel. Very convenient for Termini (main rail station) and metro. We also walked to all the attractions and only took the metro to the Vatican. Area was a bit run down but don't be too concerned, we felt very safe there. Good market over the road. Hotel decor etc. was good, the only downside was a double bed with a dip in the middle due to single occupancy. Staff were helpful and there was a big choice at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: DmnJnBrdly
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Ambra Palace. Friendly service from everyone we met (a special mention for 'Little Jimmy'), so helpful in explaining how to get around the City, very comfortable room with complimentary toiletries, the superb air conditioning was a Godsend given the humid conditions. Many people have commented on feeling uncomfortable with the location. This was our first (and not last) visit to Rome. People hang around the streets day & night all over the city, not just in this neighbourhood. We walked around the area between 10pm and midnight all the time and no one bothered us at all. You are more likely to be 'accosted' around the main tourist attractions. Do people have a problem with the ethnicity of the area? Great hotel, handy location.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klptaniko
Reviews.Content: We found this establishment to be very clean and professional. It seems that some people think the nighbourhood is scary. Well, this is an "ethnic" neighbourhood with especially some Chinese and Indian influences. If you find that scary, then you have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: chgowanderer
Reviews.Content: My main gripe is the location! As a woman traveling alone, I was afraid to walk the neighborhood streets at night. There were groups of men hanging out up and down on Via Principe Amedeo. I am an urban dweller and this was creepy! Convenient during the day however. Metro Stop Vittorio Emmanuelle one block away. Nice size room by European(and NY) standards. Generally clean. The shower was funky though with a half-glass door that allowed for the floor to get very wet when showering. Staff was generally friendly with a few exceptions. Anyway, if you don't mind a rough neighborhood, this hotel is great. However, feeling safe is important to me, so I won't be back. I would go to the other side of the Termini near Via Palestro.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ILovetotravel425
Reviews.Content: The Ambra was great! it's on the smaller side but the hote l was VERY clean and the staff was great! The rooms were on the smaller side but the bathrooms are large so it was not a problem. As first time visitors we didn't spend much time at the hotel. The area is ok - but realistically its walking distance - as in two blocks - from the Metro and a 10-15 min walk to the ruins etc. Only thing I wasn't impressed with was the breakfast tht was included but they did makea good effort ( no fresh fruit) and I'm highly picky.. so to the normal traveller there was variety and again they were very helpful. Overall great experience and would suggest the hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Italy for us”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMdtravel
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel. The double room was small but the bathroom was very large. The triple room we had was a good size. The staff was very helpful and attentive. They recommended restaurants and called to make reservations for us. There is a restaurant called CeCio that is about three blocks away that was excellent. It is only a few blocks from the main train station. Some people told us it was in a bad neighborhood but we did not have any problems and never were concerned. The neighborhood has Indian resturants and stores and I think that it is why it is wrongly described as not a good neighborhood. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awful Location”
Reviews.Author: abcabc123123
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else said, this hotel is very nice, extremely clean, and close to the Termini train station. The breakfast is absolutely wonderful with both hot foods (scrambled eggs, bacon, etc.) and pastries (croissants, toast, etc.) However, my main gripe is the location! It's not safe at all, and it's even worse at night. We were approached by a person who claimed he was a police officer, and he wanted us to get into his car. No way! Anyway, if you don't mind a rough neighborhood, this hotel is great. However, safety is important to me, so I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Royal_Honeymooners
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with a good location, good service from the staff and clean. Location is very good as it is close to the Roma Termini station, and close to the metro. However, the rooms are really small and there are no views outside the hotel. Also, the area outside the hotel is not very nice to stroll at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, typical urban neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: contactlaj
Reviews.Content: I will pretty much just reiterate what many of the other reviewers have already said. I stayed here over New Years 2006 and was quite pleased overall. The hotel itself really is a 4/5 stars by any standard, American or European. Rooms are large, clean, and comfortable. The continental breakfast is nice and there is a large seating area to enjoy breakfast. The hotel provides a free high speed internet connection which is very handy. The closest entrance to the Metro is less than a city block away. Arguably the best museum for ancient art in Rome, the National Museum’s Palazzo Massimo, is a five minute walk as is the Termini (which is a great way to get to and from the airport as trains leave about every half hour). The location is very convenient for those who want to explore the city. Many reviewers comment on the Termini neighborhood itself because it has the perception of being an immigrant community and slightly run down or dangerous-appearing at night. Personally, since most of Rome is similarly covered with graffiti and appears run-down, I would have a hard time telling a good neighborhood from a bad one without a local telling me. Talking with some of the shop and restaurant owners, I go the impression that it is actually quite a tight-knit community that looks out for one another. If you think that you might be put off by the neighborhood, then you probably will be. I would recommend this hotel for families and couples. Although I feel fine walking around at night, I think young women traveling alone might desire to stay in a different neighborhood simply because whether you have to or not, no one wants to feel like they have to look over their shoulder while they are on vacation. Personally, I would have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Northbrook
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March 2007. Thank goodness we arrived during the day and not at night as the area surrounding Termini is not exactly the nicest, and I wouldn't have liked to be consulting a map in the dark. However, once we found the hotel we felt much better - it stands out on the street as being clean and welcoming, and both the reception desk and the portering were excellent. Our room was on the 1st (non smoking) floor, adequate space-wise and the bathroom was well-equipped with lots of towels and toiletries, though no bath, only a shower. We had a problem with the sliding door to the bathroom, which twice locked itself and had to be opened by a staff member - not exactly the best thing when you need to use the room in the middle of the night! The breakfasts were very good, lots of choice. We ate in the bar one night due to the dreadful weather and the food was fine, though you wouldn't want to eat there all the time. The hotel is very near the Vittorio Emnmanuele stop on the Metro, so handy for transport. One thing we discovered on lleaving was that by taking the next side street after the hotel you got straight to the side entrance of Termini, so there was no need to walk through the less salubrious streets with all your luggage - this would also be handy if you needed to use the other metro line. As it is, you are not very near to any of the top tourist sites. All the staff were exceptionally good and we must mention the housekeeping ladies, who were so friendly and good at their work. Your room is freshened up and the bed turned down every evening - and done with a smile! The hotel was good but due to the location I'm not sure we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ambra Palace is very nice.”
Reviews.Author: FVB58B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best we stayed in on our trip to London, Paris, and Rome. Nice size to the room and very good service. I would stay at this hotel any where in the world. Location problem??? Rome is a little seedy anyway and this location is no different. We did not feel uncomfortable at any time. Great location to the metro and also the Termini should you take day trips out of Rome. Great hotel. We will book here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Really a 4 star 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: Tessandom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ambra Palace, Rome, from 16 to 25 Novemeber 2006 and we really enjoyed our trip. This genuinely is a 4 star hotel! Our room was great - spacious and very clean. The service and the staff were great. Before we booked we read other Tripadvisor reviews, yes the area is very run down but it is perfectly safe and close to Termini and the Metro. We would reccommend this hotel to anyone and we look forward to a return visit next year. Therese & Dom - Ireland

Reviews.Title: “The award winning Ambra Palace is a little gem”
Reviews.Author: francesanne
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a super overnight stay at this hotel..The staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The complimentary drinks and nibbles in the bar and free internet were nice touches. The room had good quality furniture and soft furnishings - tea/coffee making, satellite tv, internet connection, etc and the bathroom was huge with an outside window, lovely towels and ample soaps, shampoos etc. Included in the very reasonable rate is an excellent hot and cold buffet breakfast served at week ends between 7-11 am. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the main bus/train terminus and well placed for all sites. All the museums are free on the last Sunday of each month. There are plenty of reasonably priced excellent restaurants nearby but coffee is very expensive everywhere. If you arelucky enough, like we did, to get a very cheap flight from the UK, I would certainly highly recommend a stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best breakfast in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: budddd
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our four days at the Golden Tulip Ambra Palace Hotel. It was close to the train station and the Metro stop. There were many restaurants in the area. The buffet breakfast was phenomenal, the best we had in all of Italy. It was great luxury at a small price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: am42ny
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for three days in the middle of November 2006. We stayed at the Ambra Palace for 3 days and appreciated it during our stay. This Hotel is a short walk from Termini Station and the underground stop, so it is perfect location to reach the centre of Rome in a few minutes!! As indicated in Tripadvisor some reviews, the reception staff is extremely helpful and efficient and served you with a genuine smile. We relly appreciated the morning breakfast (included in the convenient room rate which we booked through the hotel website)with a large selection of pastries and cakes and the very gook Italian cappuccino! The superior room was very spacious, with elegant furniture, comfortable double bed, efficient heating systems and bathroom with whirlpool bathtub. We would definitely sty here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: RuthW
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived home from a stay in Rome. I stayed with friends at the Ambra Place Hotel. It was a very friendly hotel, wonderful rooms and amenities. Do not be put off by the surroundings. I was with three other females -and none of us felt unsafe in the locality - all the local people greeted us after the first day. It had good connections to the centre of Rome, and the front desk staff gave good recommndations for places to eat - both locally and further afield. Should I ever feel the need to return to Rome, I would consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a location for the faint hearted!!”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence434
Reviews.Content: I was astonished to see that the last three reviews were 5 star! On the positive side - the hotel staff are friendly and helpful so deserve 5 stars. The bathrooms have been partially renovated and the internet is free!! On the downside, it is in an absolutely terrible location for anyone thinking of wandering around after dark. Yes, it is not far from the Central Station but nowhere is in Rome (it is not a huge city) and like any Central Station area in any major city, it becomes an ominous place once it gets quieter. Two nights running I had a taxi driver who could not find the hotel and got dumped a few hundred metres from the hotel. However, pleasant the majority of locals, this is not an area you want to be wandering around in the dark - run down, dirty, graffitti ridden. The hotel itself is one of faded glory. The rooms have certainly seen better days and the bed and pillows were rock hard. The original standard room I had was pretty grim and the upgrade I received (at no cost and with no argument reflected very well on my view of the helpulness of the staff who were 5 star!) still very much had that faded glory feel to it. If you genuinely want to stay near the Termini station then 250 metres away and much nearer is the SAS Radisson. No meaningful difference in price (unless you start using the mini bar or restaurant in which case get out your Gold Card!) and a more superior, efficient and pleasant modern 4 star hotel right next to the Central Station. There are, of course, numerous better alternatives and locations within Rome for a traveller who wants any style of acomodation. My general comment is that if you don't need a 7 a.m. train then look at other areas within the city.

Reviews.Title: “Near faultless”
Reviews.Author: Scousejetsetter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the icing on the cake of our stay. Although some may think it was a walk out it was only ten minutes walk from Termini station and did offer more of a glimpse into "real Rome" than most hotels. I would not venture any further along the road, however, the hotel was such good value I would recommend it to anyone thinking of booking Rome. The staff were friendly, approachable and helpful at every turn. Indeed, we asked the barman for some restaurants that he may know within walking distance and both times he told us of somewhere that was classy and not too expensive. We were two couples and no one had any complaints about the hotel and although it is always difficult to recommend a hotel I would have no hesitation in telling people of this one. Whether it was a drink in the bar, breakfast or how helpful the staff were when we first checked in they were faultless. When (not if) we return to Rome, this will be our first port of call for a potential place to stay. We cannot speak highly of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rar6621
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ambra Palace for a full week. Our room was very clean and comfortable, the front desk staff was helpful and the breakfasts were just great! We were concerned about some of the reviews we read about the undesirable area of the hotel, but we found only what was typical of any large European city. We felt perfectly safe, and actually found the location to be ideal with its easy access to trains, subways and major bus routes. From Rome, we took day trips to Assisi, Orvieto, Perugia and Florence -- and the short walk to the train station (just a few blocks!) was quite a plus. The free internet access in the hotel lobby was very useful. We would stay here again without the slightest reservation and we recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “okay,but we has some problems”
Reviews.Author: 1896lg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at Golden Tulip Ambra Palace in Rome.It was ok but a little out of the city centre in the Indian community. As 3 ladies on our own we felt a little uncomfortable walking to our hotel at night as locals would be stood on street corners and it was dark. The hotel room was small with a large double bed and a sofa bed which was very uncomfortable and hard to sleep on so 3 of us slept in the double bed. The bathroom did not have a bath but a very small shower which you just stood in but could not turn round or move as it was so small, it was also a bit grubby as if it needed re-grouting. The staff were not very friendly they were quite rude at breakfast and we had to queue as breakfast was full. Rome was brilliant and we had a good time sight seeing, the best bus tour was the Roma Bus Tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but location issue”
Reviews.Author: DMU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Termini railroad station which is great if you're traveling around Italy. The staff was very professional and responsive, and the housekeeping was quite good - very much what you'd expect from a qualty 3-star hotel. The hotel is only a block from the Victoria Emmanuel metro so you can get to the major sites quickly. Although the metro trains can get quite crowded. I only wish the hotel was located in a different area, which is really what accounts for the overall rating score I gave. It's not centrally located to most of the historical sites, but walking distance to the Colosseo, and the neighborhood can feel a bit scary at night if you're traveling alone. But we had no problems. The hotel also needs a bit of a renovation, considering what it charges (e.g., our carpet was stained, furniture a little beat up).

Reviews.Title: “Past its prime and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JMG44
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel on many prior occasions, knowing full well it was in a seedy location, close and convenient to the train station. It was also immaculately maintained. Not this time. Our upgraded room had mildew above the tub and stains on the oriental carpet. The hotel was totally uncooperative in assisting us in cancelling a different date reservation - saying it could not be cancelled by phone. Then our fax was responded to by advising the room could not be cancelled by fax and it had to be cancelled on the internet. All efforts on the internet were futile as well. We will challenge any charges made to AMEX. I would not stay here ever again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Ambra Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 257, 00185 Rome, Italy
